If you don't watch Parenthood, you have a huge hole in your life that you don't even know exists.

People who don't like Parenthood: you may not know you are my mortal enemies. But you are.

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
Next panel is for The Millers in which Margo Martindale farts far more than she did on Justified or The Americans. #tcas13 #fart

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) July 29, 2013

Martindale: I've worked all my life. You just didn't notice me. I get to turn down jobs now. #CBS #TheMillers #TCAs13

— Diane Gordon (@thesurfreport) July 29, 2013

"I get to turn down jobs now," Martindale says. Picture me zipping my lip very tightly about The Millers.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) July 29, 2013

Bold prediction: The Millers will be the best show on TV by its 18th episode, which will replace dialogue entirely with farts. #tcas13

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 29, 2013

Literally just found a fart noise machine from when I was 10 so I think I'm ready for write for a sitcom now based on #tcas13

— meaning machine (@EricThurm) July 29, 2013

HIGH FIVE! (But as nerds, we'll miss) RT @TheAshleyClem: Watching TV is definitely the only kind of marathon I will ever attempt.

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) August 1, 2013

Uh-oh. TV critics are about to go ham on #Dads. Lemme get my popcorn.

— Eric Haywood (@EricHaywood) August 1, 2013

FOX using "How You Like Me Now" in the commercials for "Dads" sure feels like a dare to me.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 31, 2013

The worst part of #Dads is that it is casually racist AND horrifically unfunny. Which is not a good combination, really.

— Jace Lacob (@televisionary) August 1, 2013

So, it became one accidentally? RT @elgray: "We don't want the show to be the racial insult comedy show," says #Dads EP Mike Scully.

— Scott D. Pierce (@ScottDPierce) August 1, 2013

"We're trying to learn the things that land and don't," says #Dads EP of, uh, racist jokes. #tcas13

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 1, 2013

Mike Scully is now defending the joke "Whatcha playing, punch the Puerto Rican?" "To me, that's not offensive." GOODBYE, #DADS.

— Kate Aurthur (@KateAurthur) August 1, 2013

Martin Mull just likening his line about “punch a Puerto Rican” to “punching a redhead.” UM, NO. NO, SIR, NO. #Dads #TCAs13

— Jace Lacob (@televisionary) August 1, 2013

White men on #Dads panel "none of us found this ethnic humor offensive." Don't make me use the word #privilege #TCAs13

— Sara Bibel (@deepsoap) August 1, 2013

#Dads cast, producers somewhat aghast that TV critics missed the subtle meta-comment of the racial jokes. Everything's funnier if explained!

— Hank Stuever (@hankstuever) August 1, 2013

#Dads sole reason for existence is to make Seth McFarlane & Ryan Murphy look slightly less white and douchy at Fox. Right? #TCAs13

— Craig Ranapia (@CMRanapia) August 1, 2013

Tag line for #Dads — IT'S FREE! SHUT UP! #TCAs13

— Scott D. Pierce (@ScottDPierce) August 1, 2013

Someone let Paula Deen know she can make her comeback on #Dads #TCAs13

— Gwen Reyes (@ReelVixen) August 1, 2013

When you have to spend 30 minutes insisting that your pilot isn't racist, there may be something racist in your pilot...

— Laura Prudom (@LauInLA) August 1, 2013

And… Fox cuts the #Dads panel short. HAHAHAHAHA.

— Jace Lacob (@televisionary) August 1, 2013

There are more PR reps and actor/writers on stage than reporters for the post-session Dads scrum. That says it all. #tcas13

— TV MoJoe (@TVMoJoe) August 1, 2013

Kind of hard to tell based on Twitter...what do the critics think of #Dads? #TCAs13

— beccagrawl (@beccagrawl) August 1, 2013

For context, #Dads makes #TwoBrokeGirls look like #Louie by comparison.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) August 1, 2013

Everybody wanna be Archie Bunker. Nobody wants to bother learning how to be Norman Lear. #Dads
